events.name: Let's meet for Agile Testing, Test Automation and BDD, Singapore
events.description: Speakers: John Pickering, Managing Director & Test Practice Lead, Accenture Brynley Scully, Head of Testing, South East Asia, HPE Sandeep Mukkara, Head of Agile Transformation APAC, Johnson & Johnson Melany Fallarcuna, Managing Director & Test Practice Lead, Accenture Stefan Streichsbier, Head of Defensive Security, Vantage Point Security Ben Ishiyama-Levy, Director, Foodballs Global Amit Rawat, Test Automation Specialist, Standard Chartered Bank Topics: Keynote – Test Automation within Agile Delivery and DevOps Don’t put your eggs in one basket – Lessons learnt from Automation Testing Continuous Delivery, Role of automation in defeating our test cycles Test Automation Frameworks – Assumptions, Concepts and Tools Exploratory Testing Build well-formed maintainable and testable mobile apps with BDD Building Security into an Agile/ DevOps environment For more details, please visit our website: https://www.testingmind.com/event/agile-testing-test-automation-bdd-singapore/
events.location: Raffles City Convention Centre, 80 Bras Basah Rd Singapore 189560
events.group_name: Agile Testing, Test Automation and BDD, Singapore

events.name: So You Think You Want To Be A Product Manager
events.description:
RSVP for free here: ga.co/2ejX2CK

Partner: TradeGecko

Speakers:
Yi-Wei Ang (Senior Growth Lead, TradeGecko)
Evgeny Lazarenko (Product Manager, TradeGecko)
Francois Le Nguyen (Product Manager, TradeGecko)


Considering a career as a Product Manager? Curious about what a day-to-day job in product management looks like? Join General Assembly and TradeGecko to learn about what a day in the life entails for a product manager.

Hear from a panel of product managers as they tell all about about their professional experience in product management to see what it's like to work as a product manager. We will explore different options for branching into Product Management and discuss how Product Managers are found and hired. We will also talk about the expectations you can have throughout your career and key areas of growth within the industry.

Join us and get acquainted with the field of Product Management in Singapore.
events.location: General Assembly Singapore, 8 Claymore Hill, Level #03-01, Spacemob 229572

events.name: October Ruby Meetup
events.description: Hi folks! Join us for our next meetup, on the 25th of October at 7pm. Let us know if your company would like to sponsor or if you'd like to give a 10-15min talk or share 5 Ruby Tips.(contact details at the bottom of the page) NOTE: After your RSVP, please register at this ticketing page to secure your ticket, which will be needed at venue check-in. -------------- Programme 1. "Introduction to mruby" by Yuichiro Masui, mruby contributor and MobiRuby author 2. "Rails 5 - Serious Restroom Business", by Justin Louie from Guavapass 3. 5 Random Ruby tips - @drenmi from @tinkerbox 4. Announcements & Hot Picks- This is a 5 to 10-minute session, during which anyone can stand up and share something interesting! -------------- Interested to give a talk at future meetups? You could share about your startup technology stack,your new RubyGem, your opinions on best practices, or projects you discovered or are working on. And we are especially friendly towards beginners! See you all soon! -------------- Thank you Sponsors! Venue  Food and Drinks: @Hired_HQ  Video Recording: @engineersftw  -------------- Job Postings  1. Hired ( @Hired_HQ ) : Looking for a new job as a software engineer? Create a profile on Hired now and have the best tech startups and companies in Singapore send you offers with upfront compensation information! --- Are you looking for Rubyists? Do you have a job posting? Email us a blurb (< 50 words) + link and we'll put it here. --------------  Organisers Winston  (@winstonyw / winstonyw@gmail.com)Mingding  (@hanmd82  / hanmd82@gmail.com)Guo Xiang (@tgx_world  / tgx_world@hotmail.com)
events.location: IDA Labs Level 3 @ National Design Centre, 111 Middle Road, #03-04, 188969, Singapore

events.name: Talk CSS #11
events.description: In the double digits now and still chugging along. Help us keep this going by continuing to join us geek out on CSS! :) Latest CSS news by Talk.CSSOur new regular segment which will cover latest updates in the realm of CSS and HTML. Speakers TBC. If you want to do a lightning talk, please let us know before the event starts. We're more than happy to slot you in. CSS-related topics at ANY level are welcome because we're all here to learn and share. :) =========================================== General info We try to keep our timing tight so make sure you arrive close to the start time. Use the hash tag #SingaporeCSS whenever the urge comes.  Even if you're not a speaker this time, and get a sudden flash of inspiration, we welcome lightning talks too. Just poke us before the event starts and we'll slot you in. Lastly, if you want to speak or help out with anything, please contact Hui Jing or Chris.
events.location: Palo IT Innovation Studio, 56 Boat Quay, Singapore

events.name: HHSG OCT 25: US Elections Special Edition
events.description: A special panel discussing all things US Elections coverage - in graphics that is. From what we’ve liked, not liked and hope to see more of as the countdown to Nov 8 polling day edges closer. Simon Scarr, Deputy Head of Graphics, Thomson ReutersAlan Soon, Founder, The Splice NewsroomChi-loong Chan, Founder, VslashR Agenda7 - 7.30pm: Feel free to come earlier and mingle7.30 - 8:15: Panel discussing various graphics from polls, maps to games and what has worked best or worst in the coverage so far.8.15 - 9pm: Network & chat Any questions, comment away or email us at [masked].
events.location: ST Innovation Lab - SPH, 1000 Toa Payoh North, Singapore
